title: World Cup Qualifiers
body_text:
World Cup Qualifiers
England are in action tonight in the FIFA World Cup 2026 Qualifiers, and the imperious, enigmatic, previously erratic Everton goalkeeper, Jordan Pickford, has been selected to play in goal for the Three Lions.
Saturday 7 June 2025
17:00 Andorra v England ‚Äî ITV1
Pickford now has more England caps than any other English goalkeeper except Peter Shilton ‚Äî he only needs just 50 more caps to top the best ever.
Monday 9 June 2025
19:45 Belgium v Wales ‚Äî BBC 1
Note: the following content is not moderated or vetted by the site owners at the time of submission. Comments are the responsibility of the poster. Disclaimer ()
Posted
07/06/2025 at
15:48:32
I see where Tuchel has said ‚ÄúIt would be ideal if one of his goalkeepers was playing European football next season.‚Äù
Is he putting pressure on Pickford?
Posted
07/06/2025 at
16:38:58
Christy
That's the sort of thing coaches like Tuchel always say however he's come to England's rescue enough times while playing for us that Jordan's experience shot stopping for a poorer side than a European qualified one is beneficial.
I don't think there should be the same cach√© playing for a European qualified side these days given the recent Europa league final especially how many non- Champions are in the club tournaments.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
16:52:10
Andrew,
I find it unbelievable that Tuchel picked Jones in the squad and plays him at fullback today and 3 fullbacks in the squad?
Posted
07/06/2025 at
16:57:14
One word sums up this England manager, Henderson!
Posted
07/06/2025 at
17:43:24
This England game is not even football.
It's just shite.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
17:49:23
Liam, spot on, it‚Äôs bloody garbage.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
17:53:13
The smell in my lounge what is it?
Oh, I know, it's England on telly... üòÄ
Posted
07/06/2025 at
17:59:50
Braking into a sweat??? Wtf! Breaking breaking not fig braking! Fkng AI!!!!
Posted
07/06/2025 at
18:02:14
Tuchel just as bad as every other England manager.
Burn is shite.
James playing out of position.
Henderson is shite.
Palmer and Bellingham - brilliant players but prima donnas etc‚Ä¶.
Tuchel out!!!
Posted
07/06/2025 at
18:05:31
Having been thoroughly entertained watching the RL Challenge Cup final, this England game is a load of pony.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
18:07:58
Darts is on ITV4 and boxing on Sky if you are fed up of watching this tripe
Posted
07/06/2025 at
18:22:46
Is there any need for this Andorra goalkeeper to keep on falling to the ground every time he catches the ball, or saves a piss-weak shot?
He's doing my head in with it.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
18:26:29
Paul (8),
I watched the rugby final, a game played by men, real men, and I would have enjoyed it a bit more ‚Äòtil Hull equalised with 2 minutes to go and won the game with the conversion.
I had a tenner on Warrington but felt sorry for the Warrington defender who made the mistake for Hull's try ‚Äî he'll take a long time to forget that!
Posted
07/06/2025 at
18:26:35
Absolute garbage
Posted
07/06/2025 at
18:44:19
All them caps Pickford has had for England and he's never even scored, absolutely disgraceful.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
18:46:01
Dave,
If you want to watch a game played by men, watch the Munster hurling final now between Limerick and Cork ‚Äî unbelievable.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
18:46:05
Rat Boy with an Alice band. Nob.
Manager, coaches and players should be embarrassed by this debacle.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
18:46:13
Great game of rugby today, never disappoints.
Then football comes on. üò¥
Posted
07/06/2025 at
18:53:25
How on earth did they miss that?
Posted
07/06/2025 at
18:56:20
So these are what Tuchel calls champions league playing players? Walking around like a bunch of strutting peacocks? Bellingham and Palmer are generational talents but they need to show a bit more respect to team mates and opponents alike ie a bit more effort like
Posted
07/06/2025 at
19:02:14
Awww... Harry says it was too hot.
USA vs Turkey later on... can't see it showing anywhere on UK TV.
Is it on Peacock, Mr Gaynes?
Posted
07/06/2025 at
19:08:20
I watched some of the Rugby League and it was entertaining, even though I didn't know what was going on. Mark will have to bring a white board before England v Australia.
I switched over for the football. I can only think of one word. Turgid.
Surely there could be a filter system for there to avoid matches like this? A bit like the FA Cup qualifying rounds.
They (England) play Senegal next week. At least we get to see Gana and Ndiaye.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
19:16:27
Tuchel's ears are problem for me.
His left ear sticks out at a weird angle, much more acute ‚Äî or is it obtuse? I always get those mixed up.
Anyway, I don't trust him.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
19:26:01
Harry Redknapp was right, Tuchel is a German spy sent over to fuck up the English team.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
19:28:34
I never trust men with really skinny legs. Like Slenderman and Bill Cosby
Skinny legs, an obtuse ear and a comb over. Tuchel is probably an alien.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
19:32:47
Tuchel's comment that ‚Äúit would ideal if one of his goalkeepers played in Europe next season‚Äù is patently ludicrous.
Does he believe that Dean Henderson (2 caps) will be good enough to dislodge Jordan (75 caps) by playing in the Europa League?
Can't imagine previous world class England goalkeepers such as Banks and Shilton being treated in such an ignorant manner.
Thankfully I only endured the last 35 minutesof today's match. Evidently another dismal managerial appointment.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
19:59:57
Tuchel's grandfather first saw England through a periscope.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
20:05:10
Christy (16),
I was never fussy on the hurling games ‚Äî those sticks get in the way! Give me a Gaelic football game and I'll watch it all day long, although I'm glad Seamus turned his back on that and joined us instead.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
20:20:07
Anyone who picks Burns and Konsa as their centre-back pairing needs to have their managerial credentials questioned.
Gollum lookalike even said his goalkeepers need to play in Europe ‚Äì not thinking that none of his selected keepers are in Europe.
Complete dope and awful performance.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
20:41:15
USA vs Turkey on Fubo TV ‚Äì in Espa√±ol!
Venue: Pratt & Whitney Stadium at Rentschler Field, Hartford, Connecticut.
No Cenk Tosun for Turkey (Shame!) but this kid Alladin is playing No 20 ‚Äî Oguz Aydin, winger at Fenerbah√ße ‚Äî linked with Everton!
Posted
07/06/2025 at
20:46:41
Go USA! 1-0 up inside the 1st minute.
A brilliant finish by Jack McGlynn.
Posted
07/06/2025 at
21:01:50
Turkey just missed a sitter
Posted
07/06/2025 at
21:05:48
Can't believe Poch has lowered his standards to manage the USA. He could still do a job in one of the big European leagues
Posted
07/06/2025 at
21:07:30
1-1
Posted
07/06/2025 at
21:10:18
Hilarious goal for Turkey as Johnny fires his clearance into the Turkish player's knee and in past the US keeper.
Uh-oh, now 1-2, Turkey score again! Aydin likes to get forward, his shot deflected, I think, kneading to the goal.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
20:18:18
Wales taking a bit of a battering by Belgium in their World Cup qualifier. Currently 3-0 after 31 minutes.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
20:29:51
I'm not sure if that penalty was harsh, but Belgium are teaching Wales a football lesson.
When De Bruyne had to high-jump over the advertising hoardings, chasing to keep the ball in play, the replay shows a sly push in the back from the Wales defender.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
20:39:10
Wales penalty right on half time, again looked a bit harsh, but converted by Harry Wilson. 3-1.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
20:45:46
Always wanted Wales to do well down the years due to them having Everton players.
But having ex-kopite Bellamy as manager really puts me off. Someone who attacked a teammate with a golf club, left a youth coaching job due to bullying allegations, was cautioned by police for common assault on a female, and has been charged or convicted for numerous other offences.
A horrible person.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
20:48:46
Lifeline or the Taffs? If they can get another, the flat-track bullies will start to panic.
Love to see Wales make a fist of this.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
20:57:16
Lukebakio clean through for Belgium, on a one v one, and skies it over the bar.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
20:59:34
You might be correct, Liam.
My abiding memory of Craig Bellamy was when he refused to shake hands with John Terry in support of his teammate Wayne Bridge.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
21:00:37
Game on‚Ä¶..3-2.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
21:02:08
Game on after Belgium should have had it wrapped up with that sitter.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
21:18:41
Wow‚Ä¶..3-3.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
21:21:09
Cracking game
Posted
09/06/2025 at
21:21:32
HaHaHa.
Flat track bullies reeling.
Who'd have thought that?
Come on the Taffs!
Posted
09/06/2025 at
21:24:29
Lukebakio, a sub at half time for Belgium, has been subbed off‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶mind he has been bloody awful.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
21:30:09
That looked a throw-in for Wales in the lead-up to the Belgian fourth goal.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
21:30:23
Rom does what he does.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
21:32:20
Big deflection though took it past the keeper.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
21:34:33
Disallowed, and rightly so. The ball was well out for a throw in.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
21:34:38
Wow! VAR strikes again.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
21:37:13
Nothing wrong with that!
De Bruyne makes it 4-3.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
21:52:58
Cracking game.
I wasn't expecting that after 35 minutes.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
21:53:21
Another great game of football to watch.
De Bruyne still has it. And that Duko is someone who terrifies defenders.
I always wonder, what language do the Belgium players speak to each other? Dutch or French? Sorry, random thought.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
22:33:20
Thought the Welsh were robbed. The corner leading up to the winner was clearly a goal-kick.
Desperately poor officiating all night, I thought.
Posted
09/06/2025 at
22:39:54
Yes Colin, that was a goal kick.
It makes you wonder why VAR isn't used for other decisions rather than just offsides, goals and penalties.
I still think Belgium overall deserved the win.
